inputs.description: Pops a window prompting the user with MESSAGE. Program does not return until user responds. note: if MESSAGE is '-', it is read from stdin
inputs.name: MESSAGE

inputs.description: Same as -message to match the old prompt_user
inputs.name: PAUSE

inputs.description: What do you want the buttons to say? You can give up to three -button for three buttons. Returns integer 1, 2, or 3. If there is no -button, there will be one button 'Ok'
inputs.name: BUTTON

inputs.description: Timeout in seconds of prompt message. Default answer is returned if TT seconds elapse without user input.
inputs.name: TIMEOUT

inputs.description: Same as -timeout TT  example: prompt_popup -message 'Best disco ever?' -b Earth -b Wind -b Fire  Justin Rajendra March 2017 (stolen mostly from Ziad S. Saad)
inputs.name: TO
